input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: HPSMActor.

The items for the adapter request. This should be an XML document with a root element named "items" having a child "item", which should contain the data necessary to execute the specific request.
Create Task
This wrapper creates 'Task' record. The application saves this record into its repository which can later be used.
Sample Item Xml:
<items> <item> <operation-name>create-change-task</operation-name> <model> <keys> </keys> <instance> <header> <type>Structure</type> <task-number> <value>MyTask0051</value> <type>String</type> </task-number> <category> <value>Network</value> <type>String</type> </category> <status> <value>initial</value> <type>String</type> </status> <assigned-to> <value>assigned to</value> <type>String</type> </assigned-to> <assignee-dept> <value>assigned dept</value> <type>String</type> </assignee-dept> <coordinator> <value>coordinator</value> <type>String</type> </coordinator> <coordinator-phone> <value>coordinator phone</value> <type>String</type> </coordinator-phone> <planned-start-date> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </planned-start-date> <planned-end-date> <value>2009.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </planned-end-date> <reason> <value>reason</value> <type>String</type> </reason> <phase> <value>Connectivity</value> <type>String</type> </phase> <date-entered> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </date-entered> <open> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </open> <originator> <value>orginator</value> <type>String</type> </originator> <parent-change> <value>MyChange069</value> <type>String</type> </parent-change> <close-time> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </close-time> <company> <value>company</value> <type>String</type> </company> <SLAAgreement-i-d> <value>155</value> <type>Int</type> </SLAAgreement-i-d> <s-l-a-agreement-i-d> <value>155</value> <type>Int</type> </s-l-a-agreement-i-d> </header> <description-structure> <type>Structure</type> <description> <type>Array</type> <description> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <value>description line 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>description line 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </description> </description> </description-structure> <middle> <type>Structure</type> <product-number> <value>product number</value> <type>String</type> </product-number> <configuration-item> <value>Exchange C</value> <type>String</type> </configuration-item> <location> <value>location</value> <type>String</type> </location> <misc1> <value>misc1</value> <type>String</type> </misc1> <misc2> <value>misc2</value> <type>String</type> </misc2> <misc3> <value>misc3</value> <type>String</type> </misc3> <misc4> <value>misc4</value> <type>String</type> </misc4> <misc5> <value>misc5</value> <type>String</type> </misc5> <misc6> <value>misc6</value> <type>String</type> </misc6> <misc7> <value>misc7</value> <type>String</type> </misc7> <misc8> <value>misc8</value> <type>String</type> </misc8> <misc9> <value>misc9</value> <type>String</type> </misc9> <misc10> <value>misc10</value> <type>String</type> </misc10> <brief-description> <value>brief description</value> <type>String</type> </brief-description> <downtime-start> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </downtime-start> <downtime-end> <value>2009.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </downtime-end>
<installation-date> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </installation-date> <misc-array1> <type>Array</type> <misc-array1> <element> <value>misc array 1 - 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>misc array 1 - 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </misc-array1> </misc-array1> <misc-array2> <type>Array</type> <misc-array2> <element> <value>misc array 2 - 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>misc array 2 - 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </misc-array2> </misc-array2> <requested-units> <value>requested units</value> <type>String</type> </requested-units> <estimate-price> <value>estimate price</value> <type>String</type> </estimate-price>
<actual-units> <value>actual units</value> <type>String</type> </actual-units> <actual-cost> <value>actual cost</value> <type>String</type> </actual-cost> <actual-price> <value>actual price</value> <type>String</type> </actual-price> <SLABreached> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </SLABreached>
<next-s-l-a-expiration> <value>2009.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </next-s-l-a-expiration>
<CIDown> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </CIDown> <s-l-a-breached> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </s-l-a-breached> <c-i-down> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </c-i-down>
<asset> <type>Array</type> <asset> <element> <value>SAP</value> <type>String</type> </element> </asset> </asset>
</middle> <close> <type>Structure</type> <completion-code> <value>1</value> <type>Decimal</type> </completion-code> <closing-comments> <type>Array</type> <closing-comments> <element> <value>closing comment line 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>closing comment line 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </closing-comments> </closing-comments> </close> <initial-assessment> <value>4</value> <type>String</type> </initial-assessment> <urgency> <value>4</value> <type>String</type> </urgency> <actual-start-date> <value>2010.01.15 12:30:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </actual-start-date> <actual-end-date> <value>2010.01.16 12:30:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </actual-end-date> </instance> </model> </item> </items>
Elements' Description:
The elements provided in the instance element refer to particular field of the record. We create an instance of this record by providing information in the <value> elements.
NOTE: The elements provided in <keys> element doesn’t mean that we are asking the application that these elements (the elements in the <keys> element) should be treated as keys for the record being created. Application has pre-defined key elements. The elements given in the <keys> element are meaning-less.
Complete Elements’ Description:
NOTE: The element <task-number> is used as key. Thus this field must be populated with unique string. Or let the server choose an auto-generated key for the record.
Item [Required]:
This is a child of <items>. This <item> tag can be multiple times to support "multiple items support".
Operation-name [Required]:
This shows, what operation you want to perform.
Valid values: <operation-name>create-change-task</operation-name> is valid operation name element.
model [Required]: It is the parent tag for containing all other tags.
keys [Required]: used to ask application to search for the record with the elements inside it.
Instance [Required]: It can have many children. The children of this element describe fields of a record.
Header [Required]: It's a structure type of element, holds header information.
Task-number [Optional]: the task number.
Name of this field in the application: Task Number (Header Information.)
Valid Value: Any unique string.
Default Value: Automatically generated unique string.
Category [Required]: The category of the record.
Name of this element in the application: Category(Header information.)
Valid Values: Create group Create Release Delete Group Hardware Identify Affected Systems Maintenance Network Software Update Affected Systems Update Group
status[Optional]: the status of task.
Name of this element in the application: Status
Valid Values: initial waiting reopened closed
Or, even you can take any string too. For example “xyz123”.
assigned-to [Optional]: the person whom the task is assigned to.
Name of this element in the application: General > Assigned to (Name)
Valid Values: Any string, or you can select any existing contact record.
assignee-dept [Required]: the department of assignee.
Name of this element in the application: Assignment Group
Valid Values: Any string, or you can select any existing contact record.
coordinator [Optional]: the coordinator.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden
Valid Values: Any string, or you can select any existing contact record.
coordinator-phone [Optional] : the phone number of coordinator.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden
Valid values: Any string.
planned-start-date [Optional]: the planned starting date.
Name of this element in the application: Planned Start
Valid Values: Any input in 'DateTime' Fomat.
The DateTime format is-
YYYY.MM.DD HH:MM:SS YYYY -> Year MM -> Month DD -> Date HH -> Hours (24 hours system) MM -> Minutes SS -> Seconds.
Example, 2008.11.01 08:00:00
planned-end-date [Optional]: the planned end date.
Name of this element in the application: Planned End
Valid Values: any input in 'DateTime' format, with constraint that, it falls after 'planned-start-date'.
The DateTime format is-
YYYY.MM.DD HH:MM:SS YYYY -> Year MM -> Month DD -> Date HH -> Hours (24 hours system) MM -> Minutes SS -> Seconds.
Example, 2008.11.01 08:00:00
reason [Optional]: the reason.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
phase [Optional]: The phase of task record.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden
Valid Values: It's highly dependent on category of task record.
Note : Leave this element and let server decide its (record's) default phase.
Date-entered [Optional]: the entered date of the task record.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Adapter user normally see this field in DateTime format.
The DateTime format is-
YYYY.MM.DD HH:MM:SS YYYY -> Year MM -> Month DD -> Date HH -> Hours (24 hours system) MM -> Minutes SS -> Seconds.
Example, 2008.11.01 08:00:00
Default Value: application maintains this field by itself.
NOTE: This field is maintained by the application. So, user can't give his own input to set this field. Of course, one can use this field during retrieving the record.
open[Optional]: to tell whether the record is opened/not-opened.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: true/false (any value other than true/false would be treated as default value of the element.)
true -> record is open, false -> record is not open.
Default Value: true.
NOTE: This field is maintained by the application. So, user can't give his own input to set this field. Of course, one can use this field during retrieving the record.
Originator [Optional]: the originator of the task.
Name of this element in the application: History -> Opened By
Valid Values: Any string.
parent-change [Required]: the associated parent change.
Name of this element in the application: Parent Change.
Valid values: Any existing change record.
Close-time[Optional] : the date on which the record was closed.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Adapter user normally see this field in DateTime format.
The DateTime format is-
YYYY.MM.DD HH:MM:SS YYYY -> Year MM -> Month DD -> Date HH -> Hours (24 hours system) MM -> Minutes SS -> Seconds.
Example, 2008.11.01 08:00:00
Default value: application maintains this filed by itself.
NOTE: This field is maintained by the application. So, user can't give his own input to set this field. Of course, one can use this field during retrieving the record.
company[Optional]: the company name
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: Any string.
s-l-a-agreement-i-d [Optional]:
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
description-structure [Required]: It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type- element" -->
</structure-type-element>
description [Required]: It's an array type element.
Name of this element in the application: Description.
An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional]: each element show one row (line.)
Name of these element in the application: Description (multiple lines )
Valid Values: Any string.
middle [Required]: It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type- element" -->
</structure-type-element>
product-number [Optional]: the product number.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
configuration-item[optional]: the associated configuration item.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden
Valid Values: Any existing configuration item.
location[Optional]: the location information.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: Any string.
misc1 to misc10 [Optional]: The miscellaneous information.
Name of these elements in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
brief-description [Required]: the title for the Task.
Name of this element in the application: Title
Valid Values: any string.
downtime-start [Optional]: the downtime start Date-Time of the Task.
Name of this element in the application: Scheduled Downtime Start
Valid Values: Any input in DateTime format.
The DateTime format is-
YYYY.MM.DD HH:MM:SS YYYY -> Year MM -> Month DD -> Date HH -> Hours (24 hours system) MM -> Minutes SS -> Seconds.
Example, 2008.11.01 08:00:00
downtime-end [Optional]: the downtime end Date-Time of the Task.
Name of this element in the application: General > Scheduled Downtime End
Valid Values: Any input in DateTime format.
The DateTime format is-
YYYY.MM.DD HH:MM:SS YYYY -> Year MM -> Month DD -> Date HH -> Hours (24 hours system) MM -> Minutes SS -> Seconds.
Example, 2008.11.01 08:00:00
installation-date [Optional]: The time at which the installation take place.
Name of this element int the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any input in DateTime format.
The DateTime format is-
YYYY.MM.DD HH:MM:SS YYYY -> Year MM -> Month DD -> Date HH -> Hours (24 hours system) MM -> Minutes SS -> Seconds.
Example, 2008.11.01 08:00:00
misc-array1 [Optional]: A text field. It's array type element.
It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element[Optional]: each element shows one line of misc-array1 field.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: any string.
Default Value: “”
misc-array2 [Optional]: A text field. It's array type element.
It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element[Optional]: each element shows one line of misc-array2 field.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: any string.
requested-units [Optional]: the requested units.
Name of this element int the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
estimate-price [Optional]: a text field in the record.
Name of this element int the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
actual-units [Optional]: the requested units.
Name of this element int the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
actual-cost[Optional]: a text field in the record.
Name of this element int the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
actual-price[Optional]: a text field in the record.
Name of this element int the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
SLABreached [Optional]: a text field in the record.
Note, one can't write this field by providing input to this tag (it's read only.) One can however populate the this field with own text by providing the own value into <s-l-a-breached> element.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: true/false (any value other than true/false would be treated as default value of the element.).
true -> SLABreached ON, false -> SLABreached OFF.
Default Values: Same as input in <s-l-a-breached> element.
next-s-l-a-expiration [Optional]: Next SLA Expiration information.
Name of this element in the application : SLA -> Next Expiration
Valid values: any input in “DateTime” format.
CIDown [Optional]: A checkbox in the record.
Name of this element in the application: Configuration Item(s) Down.
Valid Values: true/false (any value other than true/false would be treated as default value of the element.).
true -> CIDown ON, false -> CIDown OFF.
s-l-a-breached [Optional]: a text field in the record.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: true/false (any value other than true/false would be treated as default value of the element.).
true -> s-l-a-breached ON, false -> s-l-a-breached OFF.
Default Value: true.
c-i-down [Optional]: a text field in the record.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: true/false (any value other than true/false would be treated as default value of the element.).
true -> c-i-down ON, false -> c-i-down OFF.
asset [Required] : this includes the associated configuration item with the change record.
It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
element [Optional]: the associated configuration item.
Name of this element in the application: Associated CI > Configuration Item.
Valid Values: Any valid configuration item.
Note: for this group, only the first configuration item (the first <element> of <assets>) is considered. Other fields are simply ignored.
close [Required]: It's a structure type element, holds close informations/comments.
completion-code [Optional]: this hold the completion code.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any decimal value.
closing-comments [Optional]: used for putting any closing comment (if any.)
It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ... </array-type-element> </array-type-element>
element[Optional]: Text field which hold the closing comments if any.
Name of these fields in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: any stirng.
initial-assessment [Required]: the initial assessment.
Name of this element in the application: Impact
Valid Values: 1, 2, 3, 4
1 -> enterprise, 2 -> site/dept, 3 -> multiple user, 4 -> user.
urgency [Required]: the urgency of the record.
Name of this element in the application: Urgency
Valid Values: 1, 2, 3, 4
1 -> critical, 2 -> high, 3 -> average, 4 -> low
actual-start-date [Optional]: Actual Start Date of the Task.
Name of this element in the application: Actual Start.
Valid Values: Any input in date time format.
The DateTime format is-
YYYY.MM.DD HH:MM:SS YYYY -> Year MM -> Month DD -> Date HH -> Hours (24 hours system) MM -> Minutes SS -> Seconds.
Example, 2008.11.01 08:00:00
actual-end-date [Optional]: Actual End Date of the Task.
Name of this element in the application: Actual End
Valid Values: Any input in date time format.
The DateTime format is-
YYYY.MM.DD HH:MM:SS YYYY -> Year MM -> Month DD -> Date HH -> Hours (24 hours system) MM -> Minutes SS -> Seconds.
Example, 2008.11.01 08:00:00

Provide username/password in form of xml.
This input parameter is required when the user wants to override the default values for username and password provided in the adapter configuration. This is required for cases where an operation cannot be executed with the default username/password provided in the adapter configuration and only user with special permissions can execute the operation. Examples of such operations can be - 'approve-change', 'deny-change', 'close-change', 'approve-task'
Sample XML Format:
<connection-parameters> <alternate-username>USERNAME</alternate-username> <alternate-password>PASSWORD</alternate-password> </connection-parameters>

output.description: The adapter response containing the results.

documentation.description:
Create Task
This wrapper creates 'Task' record via the application. The application saves this record into its repository which can later be used.
